snippet: Cardinal Keith O’Brien, Britain’s top Roman Catholic cleric and the head of the Scottish church, is the highest-ranking priest in recent history to make such an admission.
abstract: Cardinal Keith O’Brien, Britain’s top Roman Catholic cleric and head of the Scottish church, acknowledges he has been guilty of sexual misconduct, week after he announced his resignation and said he would not attend conclave to choose next pope; he is highest-ranking figure in church's recent history to make such an admission.

byline.contributor: Rachel Donadio contributed reporting from Rome and Douglas Dalby from Edinburgh, Scotland.

lead_paragraph: Cardinal Keith O’Brien, Britain’s top Roman Catholic cleric and the head of the Scottish church, is the highest-ranking priest in recent history to make such an admission.

headline.seo: Cardinal Keith O’Brien Acknowledges Sexual Misconduct
headline.main: Following Resignation, Top British Cardinal Acknowledges Sexual Misconduct
headline.print_headline: Following Resignation, Top British Cardinal Acknowledges Sexual Misconduct
